alert.note: Alert for George; Greene (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 6:15PM CDT until July 11 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Mississippi, including the following counties, George, Greene, Perry and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 615 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Leakesville, Beaumont, New Augusta, McLain, State Line, Buckatunna, Byrd, Neely, Avera, Bradley, Little Creek, Bothwell, Jonathan, Sand Hill, Progress, Hintonville, Hillman, Leaf, Piave and Ferguson.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
